intro: Rostraria festucoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf rostraria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family, commonly referred to as grasses. It is a perennial species characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, pale green flowers. Rostraria festucoides is typically found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
